poem:
### Fair Trade Dawning

In fields of toil and machines' hum,  
where fingers rake the soil,  
a mark of change within the din,  
a gentle path uncoils.

Beneath the burdened cloak of trade,  
new voices dare to call,  
where fair exchange could hold the key,  
to lift and free us all.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Fairtrade could help tackle exploitation in UK factories and farms, new boss says Fairtrade could help tackle exploitation in UK factories and farms – as well as those in developing countries – the incoming boss of the ethical trade body has said. Eleanor Harrison, who in March takes the reins of the group behind the Fairtrade mark which appears on products in shops, has said it could “offer solutions” in advising the UK government on". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
